info.title: e-Attestations RESTful APIs
info.description:
The REST / Json e-Attestations API is used to ** interface ** a **client** information system with the e-Attestations platform following the HTTP protocol.

[REST] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) (Representational State Transfer) or RESTful is a style of architecture used to build applications (Web, Intranet, Web Service) by using endpoints ( endpoints urls) and referencing resources to be exploited according to the verbs of the HTTP protocol (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc ...).

Our APIs contain predictable resource-oriented URLs, accept request bodies encoded in [JSON] format (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON), return encoded responses [JSON] (https: // en. wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON) and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication and verbs.

'Client' applications using the e-Attestations REST API enrich the Client Information System with the catalog of e-Attestations data and services in a secure and very flexible manner.

The API can also be used by integrators, software publishers, SAAS solutions or connectors.

/account.summary: This resource is the ordering customer and service subscriber to e-Attestations account.
/account.description:
This resource is the ordering customer and service subscriber to e-Attestations account.

The account identifier is returned in the `account_ids` returned in the JWT token.

In addition, you can also retrieve your account identifier from the `/account` endpoint without any parameters.

All requests must include the customer identifier so that every time the account's activation and subscription to the service are verified

schema.description: The response has a 'content' property containing statistics and an optional messages attribute (info, warn or error)

200.description: The account information associated with the TOKEN allows to know the account id and subscription to the service.

get.description:
Restore the information of the account associated with the TOKEN validated in the request.
The information details the subscription to the service.

schema.description: The response has a 'content' property containing statistics and an optional messages attribute (info, warn or error)

200.description: Gloable statistics and statistics by indicators. An indicator refers to a subset of required documents. Eg For the indicator "obligation of vigilance", the statistics will relate only to the documents of the obligation of vigilance, namely the certificate of vigilance, the proof of registration and the list of foreign employees subject to work authorization .

get.description: Restore the overall statistics of the account. The statistics relate only to the third parties monitored. A monitored Thirdparty is a Thirdparty for which there is at least one active dossier. The statistics relate to third parties and dossiers completeness.

parameters.name: monitored
parameters.description: Allows filtering on monitored third parties (monitored = true) or non-monitored third parties (monitored = false)

parameters.name: companyIdType
parameters.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

parameters.name: companyIdValue
parameters.description: Allows you to filter by Thirdparty company identifier. The identifier can be a SIRET or a VAT Number.

parameters.name: stateLastChangeDate
parameters.description: Filter to return third parties whose overall status has changed since that date.

parameters.name: thirdpartyGlobalState
parameters.description: Filter to return third parties whose overall completeness is "complete" (true) or "incomplete" (false)

parameters.name: subscriptionState
parameters.description: Allows you to filter on the registration status of a Thirdparty. This parameter allows to return the registered (subscriptionState = true) or non-registered (subscriptionState = false) third parties

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paging parameter indicating the page number.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Pagination parameter indicating the desired page size.

200.description: Returns an array of JSON objects. Each item contains the identification information of a Thirdparty (The eAttestations identifier of the Thirdparty, the type of company identifier, the company identifier of the Thirdparty and the Thirdparty code).

get.description:
## Fetch thirdparties

On its simplest form, fetch thirparties with Pagination

Get thirdparties :
`/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties`


Using pagination :
`/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?page=0&pageSize=1`

Various request parameters can be used for searching any particular thirdparty by : 

### For non French :

  - SIREN id : `/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?siren=503829368`

  - SIRET id : `/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?siret=43258335900109`

### For non French :

  - TVA id : `/api/v1/account/{{account_id}}/thirdparties?tva=B26492108`

200.description: Returns a JSON word containing detailed information from the Thirdparty

404.description: No account with this identifier (accountId) ou aucun tiers avec cet identifiant(thirdpartyId).

get.description:
Used to restore detailed information from a Thirdparty. Are reassembled:
* Thirdparty "identity" information * Thirdparty address * The list of Thirdparty users * Different states (Active?, Registered? ...)

parameters.name: thirdpartyId
parameters.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

parameters.name: companyIdType
parameters.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

parameters.name: companyIdValue
parameters.description: Filtering by company value (depends on company type)

parameters.name: thirdpartyCode
parameters.description: Thirdparty external ID (from user input or external system)

parameters.name: dossierReference
parameters.description: Allows you to filter by dossier reference. As the dossier reference is unique for a third party / dossier, if this parameter is entered, a maximum of one dossier will be returned.

parameters.name: monitored
parameters.description: Filter allowing to return monitored dossiers (monitored = true) or not followed (monitored = false)

parameters.name: stateLastChangeDate
parameters.description: Filter allowing you to return only dossiers with completeness that has changed since a given date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paging parameter indicating the page number.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Pagination parameter indicating the desired page size.

200.description: Returns an array of JSON objects. Each item contains information from a folder.

get.description: Used to restore information from one or more dossiers. It is possible to combine the available filters to refine the result.

requestBody.description: Dossier's Data to create. Contains thirdpary code information, dossier details etc. Check the body description for details

200.description: Success ful creation. ProcessId is provided.

post.description:
Create a 'dossier' for a thirdparty.

Launch e-Attestations internal processes for continuus monitoring for thirdparty compliancy.

Create a dossier for a new thirdparty (not already monitored) starts the invitation workflow (by email). Thus, all information are important during this phase.

This 'dossier' allows the client to monitor one of his thirdparty for one or a number of required documents.

Available documents depends on client subscription, configuration. Always ask you account manager for any questions. Documents are represented through 'document code' that you have to recognize in order to ask for the good requirements and reach evidences for this 'dossier'.

It's a veru powerful mecanism, giving a lot of flexibility and adaptability for the customer/system using APIs.

If the Thirdparty does not exist, it is created in the eAttestations platform.

'Dossier' creation is an **asynchronous process**. This asynchronism is induced by the process (itself of an asynchronous nature) of qualification of Thirdparty information by our internal data sources.

This endpoint launches the import process and returns a process identifier (processId).

The processing can last few minutes. In order to follow the progress of the import process and to know its result, a client can check the specific processid and know if the asynchronous creation process is complete and successful.

get.summary: Status of dossier creation async process
get.description: Status/completeness of a dossier creation by its processId

content.description: JSON Array indicating the import status of one or more dossier creation from current day -1

200.description: Returns an array of JSON objects, indicating the status and the result of imports.

get.description:
Used to find out the results of on or several dossier creation.

If the fromDate parameter is specified, the import results that will be returned are those which were launched from that date.

By default, the dossier creation results launched in the last 24 hours are returned.

/account/{accountId}/dossiers/search.description: Dossiers list search/filtering based on curated criterias

200.description: Returns an array of JSON objects. Each item contains information from a folder. Renvoie la ou les valeurs trouvées suivant les critères 'q' et 'val'

get.description: La recheche des dossiers est possible en spécifiant la donnée sur laquelle on veut effectuer une recherche 'q' et une valeur 'val' qui peut être partielle (grace au caractère '*')

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Type de recherche :
- reference : reference dossier
- credate : date de création du dossier
- enddate : fin de dossier
- status : true = status actif du dossier

parameters.name: val
parameters.description:
Valeur du critère cherché et dépendant du type de recherche.
La valeur cherchée peut être 'partielle' grace au caractère '*'.
La valeur '*' remplace une partie de la valeur de type chaine recherchée
La recherche sur '*' seule est interdite.
Par exemple : MARCH_PUB* est équivalant à "commence part MARCH_PUB*".

Account.title: Account
Account.description: Contains the information of the account (s) and its / their subscription (s).

id.description: Account ID To be used in all API calls

company.description: Name of the legal entity of the account

subscriptionDate.description: Date of subscription to the service

subscriptions.description: List of subscriptions for this account

GlobalInformation.title: Global Informations
GlobalInformation.description: This JSON word contains global statistics and statistics by indicator.

numberOfThirdparties.description: The total number of thirds of the account.

numberOfSubscribedThirdparties.description: The total number of third parties registered for a client.

numberOfCompleteThirdparties.description: The total number of third parties for which all active dossiers are complete. In other words, the third parties who have submitted all the documents required by this client.

numberOfDossiers.description: The total number of active dossiers.

numberOfCompleteDossiers.description: The total number of complete dossiers. In other words, the dossiers for which all the required documents have been uploaded but the third party.

listIndicatorsStatistics.description: Table containing statistics by indicator (E.g. Obligation of vigilance).

StatisticsIndicator.title: Statistics indicator
StatisticsIndicator.description: Word Json containing statistics on an indicator (E.g. Obligation of vigilance).

numberOfThirdparties.description: The number of thirds of the ordering customer account restricted on this indicator.

numberOfSubscribedThirdparties.description: The number of third parties registered restricted on this indicator.

numberOfCompleteThirdparties.description: The number of third parties for which all the dossiers are complete, restricted on this indicator.

numberOfDossiers.description: The number of accounts in the account, restricted on this indicator.

numberOfCompleteDossiers.description: The number of complete accounts in the account, restricted on this indicator.

NewDossier.title: Dossier to be created
NewDossier.description: Body of the dossier to be created

companyIdType.description: Thirdparty's company type of identifier ('CIT001' for SIRET, 'CIT002' for VAT)

companyIdValue.description: Thirdparty company identifier (SIRET or intra community VAT)

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an internal identifier for the client

expirationDate.description: Dossier's expiration date. After this date, the third party is no longer monitored

thirdpartyEmail.description: List of emails from third-party contacts. If a Thirdparty is not registered, these emails will be used to send the invitations.

userInCharge.description: List of emails from those responsible for the file on the ordering side. If an email does not correspond to any registered user, an invitation to register on the ordering e-Attestations platform is sent to this Email.

complete.description: true if the dossier creation is complete, false otherwise

success.description: true if the dossier creation is sucessful, false otherwise

isComplete.description: 'true' if the dossier creation is complete, 'false' otherwise

isSuccessful.description: 'true' if the dossier creation is successful, 'false' otherwise

ThirdpartyIdentifier.title: Thirdparty identifier
ThirdpartyIdentifier.description: JSON word representing the identifying information of a Thirdparty.

thirdpartyId.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

companyIdType.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

companyIdValue.description: Third-party company identifier (SIRET or intra-community VAT).

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an internal client identifier.

ThirdpartyDetails.title: Details of a Thirdparty
ThirdpartyDetails.description: JSON word representing Details of a Thirdparty. The information constituting the address as well as the corporate name of the Thirdparty is provided by our Data Provider from the identifier of the Thirdparty.

thirdpartyId.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

companyIdType.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

companyIdValue.description: Third-party company identifier (SIRET or intra-community VAT).

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an internal client identifier.

monitored.description: Indicates whether the Thirdparty is being followed. This attribute is true if the Thirdparty is followed, false otherwise. A Thirdparty is followed up as soon as they have a followed up file.

name.description: Thirdparty company name. This is automatically provided by our data provider using the Thirdparty identifier (Siret number or VAT number)

subscriptionState.description: Thirdparty registration status. True if the Thirdparty is registered, False otherwise.

outOfBusiness.description: Indicates whether the establishment is closed. True if it is, False otherwise.

stateLastChangeDate.description: Last date on which the overall state of the Thirdparty changed.

thirdpartyGlobalState.description:
Overall completeness of the Thirdparty. A value of true means that all dossiers are in the complete state.
A value of false (Incomplete) means that at least one or more dossiers are in the incomplete state.
A value of null (n/a) means that the thirdparty is not currently under account's monitoring.

capitalCurrency.description: Currency of known capital for the Thirdparty

datecreation.description: Date of creation of the Thirdparty in the eAttestations database

lastBalanceSheetDate.description: Last date of known operating income

siret.description: SIRET identifier of the establishment (for French thirdparties)

turnoverCurrency.description: Currency of last known third-party turnover

thirdpartyUsers.description: Information about the users of the third-party account.

isMonitored.description: Indicates whether the Thirdparty is being followed. This attribute is true if the Thirdparty is followed, false otherwise. A Thirdparty is followed up as soon as they have a followed up file.

isOutOfBusiness.description: Indicates whether the establishment is closed. True if it is, False otherwise.

isRegistered.description: Thirdparty registration status. 'true' if the Thirdparty is registered, 'false' otherwise.

isComplete.description:
Overall completeness of the Thirdparty.
- A value of 'true' (complete) means that all files are in the 'complete' state.
- A value of 'false' (uncomplete) means that at least one or more files are in the 'incomplete' state.
- A value of 'n/a' means that the thirdparty is not currently under account's monitoring.

phone.description: Numéro de téléphone de l'utilisateur au format international.

expirationDate.description: File expiration date. After this date, the file is no longer followed (Attribute "monitored" of the file changes to false)

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty code. It is an internal client identifier.

thirdpartyEmail.description: List of emails from third-party contacts. If a Thirdparty is not registered, these emails will be used to send the invitations.

Dossier.title: Dossier
Dossier.description: Dossier content information, details, documents etc.

thirdpartyId.description: Identify e-Attestations of the Thirdparty. This is different from the companyIdValue. The thirdpartyId is a technical identifier that uniquely identifies the Thirdparty in the eAttestations platform.

companyIdType.description: Third-party company identifier type (CIT001, CIT002 etc.).

companyIdValue.description: Principal Thirdpary's company ID code (which is SIRET or TVA codes most of the time).

thirdpartyCode.description: Thirdparty Code. This code is an external key (a.k.a from within client system)

companyCountryCode.description: Third country code. This is an alpha-3 code from the ISO 3166-1 standard.

monitored.description: Indicates if the dossier is followed/active (True) or not followed (False)

expirationDate.description: Expiration date for follow-up From this date, the file automatically changes to the "not followed" state

stoppingReason.description: Details concerning the termination of the file: OUTOFBUSINESS (company canceled), EXPIRATION (the file has reached its expiration date), STOPREQUEST (a request to stop was made in an explicit and immediate manner), UNKNOWN (information absent). Not null only if folder deactivated.

state.description: File completeness indicator. True if all the requested documents are present, false otherwise.

stateLastChangeDate.description: Date of the last change in the completeness of the file.

indicators.description: List of indicators in the dossier.

documents.description: List of documents requested for the file.

isMonitored.description: Indicates if the dossier is followed/active (True) or not followed (False)

Requirement.title: Requirement
Requirement.description: A requirement, document or evidence proof required

descriptionCategoryFr.description: Description of the category of the requirement in French

descriptionCategoryEn.description: Description of the category of the requirement in English

descriptionFr.description: Description of the requirement in French

descriptionEn.description: Description of the requirement in English

DossierIndicator.title: Dossier indicator
DossierIndicator.description: Status of a dossier for completness or other kind of information

state.description: State of the indicator. True if all the requested documents of the indicator are present, false otherwise.

lastChangeDate.description: Date of the last change in the status of the indicator.

isComplete.description: State of the indicator. True if all the requested documents of the indicator are present, false otherwise.

Document.title: Document or evidence requested for the file
Document.description: A requirement such as a requested document, a signature, something to bring to the file

listFileInformation.description: Information of the file (s) present for this document.

FileInformation.title: File information
FileInformation.description: File informations uploaded by the thirdparty or automaticaly by e-Attestations

ReactivateDossierData.description: Information of the file to be updated when reactivating the follow-up.

expirationDate.description: Expiration date of the follow-up of the file. After this date, the file is no longer followed (Attribute "monitored" of the file changes to false).

Messages.description: Messages from a response to a REST / JSON API call. It contains information, warning and error messages.

ResponseDossierCreation.title: Reponse for a dossier creation
ResponseDossierCreation.description: Information with processId of dossier's creation an messages

Response.title: Root Type for content
Response.description: The content of a reponse is an Array of JSON Object depending of the request.

content.description: The content of the reponse for the request (when HTTP 200)

page.description: The page number when the response is paginated

size.description: The page size provided for this request

totalElements.description: The total number of elements for the requested resources.

messages.description: The messages provided for this reponse

response.description:
Reponses are provided with a :

    - content (JSON Array) : provinding the content for the request when it exists (HTTP 200)

    - messages (JSON Array) : (optinaly provided) proviging messages for INFO, WARM and ERRORS level.


The page number, page size and number total of elements are also provided (for main resources).

Bearer.description: To perform an authentication you must add an HTTP header in the form 'Authorization: Bearer {JWT}' where 'access_code' is the JWT provided by e-Attestations authentication service
